support_summary: ATXN3 interacts with and deubiquitinates the E3 ubiquitin ligase HUWE1 (also known as Mule), thereby stabilizing it and regulating its function in cellular processes like DNA damage repair.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 interacts with and deubiquitinates the large E3 ubiquitin ligase HUWE1 (Mule). This deubiquitination protects HUWE1 from autoubiquitination-mediated degradation, thereby stabilizing it.
functions.effect_description: By stabilizing HUWE1, ATXN3 regulates the function of this E3 ligase, which has numerous substrates involved in processes like DNA damage repair and apoptosis.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 deubiquitinates HUWE1 -> HUWE1 is stabilized -> Regulated ubiquitination of HUWE1 substrates -> Control of DNA damage response and other pathways
specific_effects: ATXN3 counteracts the autoubiquitination of HUWE1.

evidence.paper_title: The deubiquitinase function of ataxin-3 and its role in the pathogenesis of Machado-Joseph disease and other diseases

mechanism: ATXN3 interacts with and deubiquitinates the large E3 ubiquitin ligase HUWE1 (Mule). This deubiquitination protects HUWE1 from autoubiquitination-mediated degradation, thereby stabilizing it.
effect: By stabilizing HUWE1, ATXN3 regulates the function of this E3 ligase, which has numerous substrates involved in processes like DNA damage repair and apoptosis.
summary: ATXN3 activates HUWE1 to modulate huwe1 protein stability.

evidence.paper_title: The deubiquitinase function of ataxin-3 and its role in the pathogenesis of Machado-Joseph disease and other diseases

pathways.name: Deubiquitination and Stabilization of Substrate Proteins
